p: The translation of this, and similar SESR-based schemata for other livelihood modes and of the above principles into operational criteria is a crucial next step. This includes explicit protocols tailored to needs of VBD intervention planners and managers. The absence until recently of such criteria even if generic but including explicit guidelines and/or protocols (i.e., generally applicable to all bioclimatic zones, biome types, or ecosystems) has been a major factor limiting application of the SESR frame including the ‘ecosystem approach to health’ [ 34]. A separate, small but growing literature has developed suggesting the application of SESR to climate change adaptation (e.g., [ 97– 99].
